definition: to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary
surname Quan
to weigh/weight/measure
to weigh the pros and cons (idiom)

sentences.english: Read the links above, become informed, weigh the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 請讀一讀上面的鏈接，自知，然後權衡。

sentences.english: This is the part of the brain we use to weigh the pros and cons or engage our "expertise."
sentences.chinese: 這部分大腦用來權衡利弊或利用“經驗”。

sentences.english: And how do we balance that with the freedom of speech?
sentences.chinese: 以及我們如何權衡演說的自由度？

sentences.english: There are, however, some trade-offs involved in how we can present that information.
sentences.chinese: 不過，關於如何呈現該信息涉及到一些權衡標準。

sentences.english: women give a more balanced weighting.
sentences.chinese: 女人則對此更慎重權衡。

sentences.english: She balanced the attractions of a high salary against the prospect of working long hours .
sentences.chinese: 她對高薪和長工時兩者的利弊作了權衡比較。

sentences.english: Often if such a trade-off exists, it nullifies the study results.
sentences.chinese: 通常這種權衡一出現，研究結果就算作廢了。

sentences.english: Any preoccupation with ideas of what is right or wrong in conduct shows an arrested intellectual development.
sentences.chinese: 耽於權衡舉止的孰是孰非，是心智發展受困的表現。

sentences.english: Cost-benefitanalysis weighs the costs against the benefits.
sentences.chinese: 成本效益分析根據收益權衡成本。

sentences.english: As you would expect, there are various trade-offs associated with each topology.
sentences.chinese: 如您所料，每種拓撲結構都存在不同的權衡。

sentences.english: Thus, they have the same trade-off as their general-purpose, back-end compressors.
sentences.chinese: 因此，它們與自己的通用後端壓縮器具有相同的權衡。

sentences.english: I balanced the benefits against the costs of medical insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我權衡了醫療保險的好處和它的花費。

sentences.english: And I must weigh all of the challenges that our nation faces.
sentences.chinese: 另外，我必須權衡我們國家面臨的各種挑戰。

sentences.english: This situation can be characterised generally as a trade-off between verbosity and flexiblity.
sentences.chinese: 這種情形一般可以描述爲冗長與靈活性之間的權衡。

sentences.english: Because our document isn't large or complex, there's no point in making this trade-off.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們的文件不大也不復雜，所以無需權衡這一點。

sentences.english: I was still balancing the matter in my mind .
sentences.chinese: 我心裏正在權衡利害得失。

definition: to make a decision/resolution/decisiveness/resolute
to choose (literary)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
mature reflection/after careful deliberations
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
prattle/idle chit-chat
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
preconceived idea/bias/prejudice
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
success or failure
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
absolutely safe/surefire/thorough
